Qualifiers.scope: City of Palo Alto, CA — Determination of net lot area for development potential
applicability: All lots in Palo Alto when calculating development potential
For most lots, gross and net lot areas are equal; apply exclusions only where applicable features exist

Variables.name: gross_lot_area
Variables.description: Total lot area measured from lot line to lot line.
Variables.units: area (units not specified in text; typical practice: square feet or square meters)

Variables.name: net_lot_area
Variables.description: Area used to determine development potential; computed by subtracting specified exclusions from gross lot area.

Variables.name: area_within_public_ROW
Variables.description: Portion of the lot that lies within the public street right-of-way (ROW) or public street easement (Figure 1, Area A).

Variables.name: flag_lot_pole_area
Variables.description: The 'pole' portion of a flag lot that provides narrow access to the street (Figure 2, Area B).

Variables.name: creek_channel_area
Variables.description: Portion of the lot within the creek channel as defined by the Santa Clara Valley Water District (SCVWD) easement, or if no easement, by the top-of-bank (Figure 3, Area C).

Constants.name: development_potential_basis
Constants.spec: Development potential is based on net lot area, not gross lot area.

mandatory: Subtract all applicable excluded areas (public ROW overlap, flag-lot pole, creek channel area) from gross_lot_area to determine net_lot_area.

conditional.if: No excluded areas are present on the lot

depends_on: Exclusion Area A: Public ROW overlap

Qualifiers.scope: Exclusion Area A — Public street right-of-way (ROW) overlap
applicability: Lots whose legal boundaries extend into a public street ROW or public street easement
Includes areas in Palo Alto (e.g., Barron Park) where the lot may extend to the centerline of the street

Variables.name: public_ROW_edge
Variables.description: Edge line of the public street easement or public ROW used to define lot area for calculation purposes.
Variables.source: City of Palo Alto Development Center (ROW dimensions available)

Variables.name: area_within_public_ROW
Variables.description: Computed area of the portion of the lot that lies within the public ROW or street easement to be subtracted from gross lot area (Figure 1, Area A).

Constants.name: lot_area_reference_boundary
Constants.spec: For lot area purposes, the lot is defined by the edge of the public street easement or public ROW, not by the legal lot line if it extends into the ROW.

mandatory: Subtract the portion of the lot that lies within the public ROW or street easement from the gross lot area.

conditional.if: Lot boundaries extend into the public ROW
conditional.then: Determine public_ROW_edge per city records and compute area_within_public_ROW for subtraction
conditional.notes: ROW dimensions must be obtained from the City of Palo Alto Development Center.

supplies_to: Net lot area calculation and development potential basis
external_references: City of Palo Alto Development Center — Public ROW dimensions

applicability: Lots configured as flag lots where a narrow 'pole' or 'handle' connects the main lot area to the street
exclusions: Private access easements located on a lot that provide access to other lots (these are not subtracted from the lot on which they occur)

Variables.name: flag_lot_pole_area
Variables.description: Area of the narrow connection ('pole') of a flag lot to the street (Figure 2, Area B).

Variables.name: private_access_easements_area
Variables.description: Area of private access easements located on the lot (not subtracted from this lot’s area).

Constants.name: non_subtraction_of_private_access_easements
Constants.spec: Private access easements that provide access to lots are NOT subtracted from the lot on which they occur.

mandatory: Subtract the 'pole' portion of a flag lot from the gross lot area.

Exceptions: Do not subtract private access easements from the lot on which they occur, even if used to access other lots.

supplies_to: Net lot area calculation and development potential basis

Qualifiers.scope: Exclusion Area C — Creek channel/easement area
applicability: Lots with a creek, creek channel, and/or a recorded creek easement on or across the lot

Variables.name: scvwd_easement_boundary
Variables.description: Boundary of the Santa Clara Valley Water District easement, if present, which defines the creek channel area to be subtracted.
Variables.source: Santa Clara Valley Water District records

Variables.name: top_of_bank_line
Variables.description: The top-of-bank line used to define the creek channel where no SCVWD easement exists.
Variables.source: Field determination; may require a licensed surveyor

Variables.name: creek_channel_area
Variables.description: Area within the creek channel to be subtracted from the gross lot area (Figure 3, Area C).

Constants.name: creek_area_definition_hierarchy
Constants.spec: Creek channel area is defined by the SCVWD easement; if there is no easement, use the top-of-bank.

mandatory: Subtract the portion of the lot within the creek channel from the gross lot area.

conditional.then: Define creek_channel_area using the SCVWD easement boundary

conditional.notes: Determining the top-of-bank may require a surveyor.

supplies_to: Net lot area calculation and development potential basis
external_references: Santa Clara Valley Water District (SCVWD) — Easement records
